Home Assistant.description:
Open source home automation that puts local control and privacy first.

Note that this container uses host networking to allow for multi-cast and uPnP functionality that Home Assistant provides. This version also using a non-root user.

Based on a custom OCI image, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.

8123.description: Home Assistant UI port. Because host network mode is used, this must be set to port 8123. You may need to open the same port on your firewall (protocol: tcp).
8123.label: Server port

/config.description: Choose a Share for configuration. E.g.: create a Share called ha-config for this purpose alone.
/config.label: Home Assistant Config Share

PUID.description: Enter a valid User ID (UID) to run Home Assistant with. It must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PUID.label: UID

PGID.description: Enter a valid Group ID (GID) to use along with the above UID. It(or the above UID) must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
PGID.label: GID
